Docs.summary: Stores ASP.NET page view state on the Web client in a hidden HTML element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks ASP.NET pages can store <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> state between the inherently stateless HTTP request and response required to process and serve any Web page. This state is called "view state". The default mechanism used to store view state for a page and its controls is in one or more `<hidden>` HTML fields included in the page that is served to a client from a Web server. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class can use the HiddenFieldPageStatePersister class to do this work. HiddenFieldPageStatePersister implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.HiddenFieldPageStatePersister.Save%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.HiddenFieldPageStatePersister.Load%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister> class so that the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> can store state in a `<hidden>` HTML element named "__VIEWSTATE" on a Web client. When the client requests the same page from the Web server (a postback), the `<hidden>` element is parsed and converted to state information by ASP.NET.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> instance that is requested has an associated <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter> class, it retrieves the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister> object from this adapter using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.GetStatePersister%2A> method. Adapters can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.GetStatePersister%2A> method to return a <xref:System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister> object that stores page and control state in some way that a specific client supports. For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.SessionPageStatePersister> class stores page and controls' state on the Web server, instead of the client, to decrease the amount of information that must be sent and stored on a client that has potentially limited memory and bandwidth.
The maximum size of the "_VIEWSTATE" `<hidden>` HTML element can be set through the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.MaxPageStateFieldLength%2A> property or through the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.PagesSection.MaxPageStateFieldLength%2A> configuration setting. When this value is set and the length of the "_VIEWSTATE" element would exceed the maximum length, the content is divided into multiple "_VIEWSTATE" elements.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to bind a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control to data in a database with a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> control.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource_1sql#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.hiddenfi_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource_1sql#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.hiddenfi_1.aspx)]
When the example page is viewed, any view state is stored by the HiddenFieldPageStatePersister class in a `<hidden>` HTML element named "__VIEWSTATE".
``` <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 Transitional//EN"> <HTML> <BODY> <form name="_ctl0" method="post" action="sample.aspx" id="_ctl0">
<input type="hidden" name="__VIEWSTATE" value="" />
<select size="4" name="ListBox1" id="ListBox1"> <option value="Buchanan">Buchanan</option> <option value="Callahan">Callahan</option> <option value="Davolio">Davolio</option> <option value="Dodsworth">Dodsworth</option> <option value="Fuller">Fuller</option> <option value="King">King</option> <option value="Leverling">Leverling</option> <option value="Suyama">Suyama</option> </select>
</form> </BODY> </HTML> ```

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.HiddenFieldPageStatePersister> class implements the Load method to load page and control state information from an incoming request to the Web server. The <xref:System.Web.UI.ObjectStateFormatter> object accessed by the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister.StateFormatter%2A> property is used to deserialize the data.

Docs.exception: The Load method could not successfully deserialize the state information contained in the request to the Web server.

Docs.summary: Serializes any object state contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister.ViewState%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister.ControlState%2A> property and writes the state to the response stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.HiddenFieldPageStatePersister> implements the Save method to persist page and control state to a client by writing it to a `<hidden>` HTML element in the outgoing response to the client. The <xref:System.Web.UI.ObjectStateFormatter> object accessed by the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister.StateFormatter%2A> property is used to deserialize the data.
